subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: The Parsees: Zoroastrians Who Fled to India
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Parsees: Zoroastrians Who Fled to India.

hook.text: When Islam conquered Persia, some Zoroastrians refused to convert. They sailed to India and built a new home.

buildup.text: The Parsees arrived in Gujarat, India around 800 CE. Legend says they promised to blend in like sugar in milk.

discovery.text: Despite tiny numbers, Parsees became wildly successful: the Tata family, Freddie Mercury, and Zubin Mehta are Parsee.

twist.text: With fewer than 60,000 left, the Parsee community faces extinction. They don't accept converts. Numbers keep falling.

climax.text: The Parsees show a religion can survive exile but not demographics. Faith needs children, not just belief.

punchline.text: 60,000 left, no converts allowed. Parsees survive exile but face extinction.

quiz.question: Why are the Parsees declining in number?
options: They don't accept converts and have low birth rates
